result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shane T Lozano

records.addlTxt:
9:02 AM Defendant Shane T Lozano in court.  Prosecuting attorney Matthew W Kline in court for the State of Wisconsin. DAR Court Reporter: Taryn Strickland. 
Deft has not hired an atty yet.
Deft did not qualify for SPD representation.
Deft just started work again a month ago and needs more time to come up with the money to hire an atty.
Court reviews the Deft's Petition for an atty again.
Court cannot grant an appointment of an atty due to the deft's total income.
State puts their offer on the record.
Deft indicates that was not the offer he remembered.
BTC: Matter adjourned for deft to figure out what he wants to do.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Deft does not qualify for SPD representation.

BTC: Court appointed atty is denied.
State objects to any bond modification.
BTC: Modify bond in case 22CM846 to a $1000 signature bond, all conditions remain, matters adjourned.

DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE
Racine County Pretrial Risk Assessment Report

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. No contact with the victim R.P or 1607 Russet ave (person, property, residence or family). Must update address with courts. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.

2:17 PM Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Shane T Lozano appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney McKenna Marie Quinter in court for Shane T Lozano. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.
Status conference scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on July 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
